bestBHT.bht: As the disciples sailed across the sea, their boat filled with water as a storm came down upon them. The winds beat into the boat, creating a dangerous situation. These sudden squalls were known to be perilous on the small lake. In the midst of the chaos, Jesus fell asleep, demonstrating his trust in the Father's protection. Though the disciples were experiencing great jeopardy, Jesus remained undisturbed, finding rest amidst the storm.

Henry Alford: 23.] came down—from the sky,—or perhaps from the the mountain valleys around: see Matt. vii. 27, and note on Acts xxvii. 14.
Jamieson-Fausset-Brown: getting filled,' that is, those who sailed; meaning that their
Marvin Vincent: The word describes the action of the sudden storms which literally came down from the heights surrounding the lake.
Mark, as usual, goes into minuter detail, and describes how the waves beat into the boat.
Archibald T. Robertson: These wind storms rushed from Hermon down through the Jordan gorge upon the Sea of Galilee and shook it like a tempest.
These sudden squalls were dangerous on this small lake.
It was the boat that was being filled and it is here applied to the navigators as sailors sometimes spoke.
John Gill: But as he sailed he fell asleep...
...and there came down a storm of wind on the lake...
...and were in jeopardy; of their lives, in the utmost danger, just ready to go to the bottom.

bhtAttempts.bht: As the disciples sailed across the sea, their boat was swiftly being filled with water as a storm descended upon them. The fierce winds beat into the boat, creating a perilous situation. Storms like these were known to rush down from the heights surrounding the lake, shaking it like a tempest. The boat was in such danger that it seemed as if the disciples were about to lose their lives. In the midst of this chaos, Jesus, exhausted from his ministry work, was sound asleep. His ability to find rest even in the face of danger displays his unwavering trust in the Father's protection.

As the disciples sailed, their boat filled with water as a storm descended. The fierce winds beat into the boat, creating a perilous situation. Storms like these were known to shake the lake like a tempest. The boat was in danger, with the disciples' lives at stake. In the midst of chaos, Jesus, exhausted, slept soundly. His ability to rest even in danger displayed his unwavering trust in God's protection.

As the disciples sailed across the sea, their boat filled with water as a storm came down upon them. The winds beat into the boat, creating a dangerous situation. These sudden squalls were known to be perilous on the small lake. In the midst of the chaos, Jesus fell asleep, demonstrating his trust in the Father's protection. Though the disciples were experiencing great jeopardy, Jesus remained undisturbed, finding rest amidst the storm.

As the disciples sailed, their boat was getting filled with water, posing a serious threat. These sudden storms came down from the heights surrounding the lake, shaking it forcefully. The disciples' lives were in jeopardy, on the brink of going under. Amidst this turmoil, Jesus fell off into a deep sleep, exemplifying his unwavering trust in the Father's care. Despite the danger they faced, Jesus remained calm, finding rest even in the midst of the storm.

As the disciples sailed, their boat was getting filled with water, while the winds beat into it, making their situation increasingly hazardous. These sudden storms were known to be dangerous on the small lake. Nonetheless, Jesus, exhausted from his ministry, fell asleep amidst the chaos. He trusted in the Father's protection, displaying unwavering faith. Even though the disciples were in great jeopardy, their lives in imminent danger, Jesus remained undisturbed, finding solace in rest.
